column4: before, the desktop icon of my flv video is a frame from the video. now that I reformatted, it just looks like a blank white paper. how do I make the icon a frame from the vid again? :D
have you opened the video yet?
try opening it in totem or whatever kde uses to play videos if you're on kde
okay. tomd :D
i tried switching my system over to kde, then kaffeine wouldn't properly play videos, so I blew it off, I think i like gnome better anyway
I opened it already tomd...
no diff
I just tried on one of mine.. blank page, then a few minutes of being in the directory and opening the file, they changed to pictures
dunno why yours isn't doing it..  there must be a preference for it somewhere..
i solved your problem
tomd!!!
yes??
run gconf-editor from a terminal
and then, tomd? :D
go to desktop->gnome->thumbnailers->video@flv and make sure enable is checked
also make sure gnome-video-thumbnailer is installed
$ gnome-video-thumbnailer
Expects an input and an output file
mmm
ok, so its there, did you check the gconf setting I showed you, is enable checked?
yes :D
well, everything is in working order.. do other filetypes work? maybe its a newer version of the codec, etc. im not really sure
